intro: Corispermum dutreuilii var. dutreuilii, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a low-growing, perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, fleshy, spiny leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its succulent tissues and deep root system. This species is often found in sandy soils and plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion.
